intro: Omphalocarpum adolfi-friederici, commonly known as the Australian burr medic, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and distinctive, spiny pods. The plant is an annual herb that grows in arid and semi-arid regions, often found in disturbed soils. Its seeds are enclosed in a spherical, woody capsule that splits into three segments when mature, aiding in seed dispersal. The plant is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Australian medicine.
